newsitem.title: USA: U.S. gasoline firms on ACCESS, but pressure seen.
newsitem.headline: U.S. gasoline firms on ACCESS, but pressure seen.

text.p: U.S. gasoline remained firm on ACCESS on Tuesday while the rest of the energy complex came under pressure from rising distillate stocks.
The American Petroleum Institute (API) released data on Tuesday which showed a distillate build-up of 1.30 million barrels for the week ended October 4.
The increase lifted stocks to 17 million barrels below last year, versus a deficit of 20 million seen in recent weeks.
Gasoline, which has lagged heating oil and crude recently, was up 0.10 cent from the settlement after hitting an after-hours high of 67.25 cents a gallon.
A reported drawdown of 810,000 barrels last week buoyed the contract.
November unleaded traded at 66.60 cents a gallon in late business on volume of about 60 lots.
But traders said profit-taking would weaken the overall complex on Wednesday and forecast selling of front months and buying of back months.
Heating oil traded at 75.90 cents a gallon by 2100 EDT/0107 GMT on ACCESS, down 0.29 cent from the settle, on 200 lots.
The front-month crude contract fell 14 cents a barrel to $25.40 a barrel on ACCESS, with 700 lots changing hands.
